method.name: Wilcoxon Signed-Rank Test

reference.ref: Wilcoxon, F. Individual Comparisons by Ranking Methods. Biometrics 1 (1945) 80-83

generalDescription.type: Statistical two sample means comparation using the Wilcoxon Signed Rank Test
generalDescription.objective: Execution of the non-parametric test for pair-wise comparison of the global performance of two classification methods.
generalDescription.howWork: The ImbWilcoxon Signed-Rank Test is a method for comparing the performance of two algorithms using statistics techniques. It can be used in k-folds cross validation training experiments. The ImbWilcoxon Signed-Rank Test is associated to testing results of the two models in an experiment that are to be compared. Once those models has been trained and tested, the ImbWilcoxon Signed-Rank Test takes place. The process calculates the corresponding imbalanced measure for the whole partition results in each dataset (average performance). The statistical sample includes all of those average imbalanced measures for each method to be compared. Then the ImbWilconxon signed rank test is executed in order to obtain the p-value associated to check if the Null hypothesis is rejected and there are statistical differences between both methods.

parameterSpec.param: imbalancedMeasure: The measure used in the method, one of the measures used imbalanced classification area

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Methods to compare: Clas-C45 vs Clas-MLPerceptron-BackProp Datasets: haberman, pima, wisconsin, ecoli1, glass1 Type of partitions: k-fold, k=5
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the ./results/Stat-Imb-Wilcoxon/TSTClas-C45vsClas-MLPerceptron-BackProp folder the results0s0.stat file:
Wilcoxon signed rank test, Imbalanced Classification Area Under the ROC Curve in each fold: Algorithm = Clas-C45 Fold 0 : 0.7002314814814815 Fold 1 : 0.7285714285714286 Fold 2 : 0.7333333333333334 Fold 3 : 0.7928571428571429 Fold 4 : 0.7444444444444445 Mean Value: 0.7398875661375662 Algorithm = Clas-MLPerceptron-BackProp Fold 0 : 0.5231481481481481 Fold 1 : 0.7523809523809524 Fold 2 : 0.6345238095238095 Fold 3 : 0.5988095238095239 Fold 4 : 0.5814814814814815 Mean Value: 0.618068783068783 Null hypothesis, true difference in means is equal to 0 Output=0: There is no evidence against H0 p-values: 0.09189221109700552
and a LaTeX output file "output.tex" where the results of the application of the test is provided.
